Judge OK's sex change for Mass. inmate

A federal judge in Boston has ordered the state prison system to provide a taxpayer-funded sex change operation for Michelle Kosilek (left), a transgender inmate serving a life sentence for murder. (Boston Globe)

but plenty of prospectors

Sewing nonprofit teaches refugees

The Stitching Studio in Lowell is a two-year-old program that teaches professional sewing skills to legal refugees and immigrants.

MassMutual is fighting several lawsuits accusing the insurer of shorting policyholders on dividends and preventing many of them from voting for directors.
